briefTitle: Longitudinal Study of Dental Implant Therapy in HIV Positive Patients
officialTitle: Longitudinal Study of Dental Implant Therapy in HIV Positive Patients

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy enough to undergo the proposed therapy without compromise to existing health status
* At least 19 years old
* Able to read and understand written English without the aid of ad hoc interpretation
* Able to cognitively understand the proposed study and therapy and possible prognoses
* Able to consent for their own inclusion in the study.
* Implant supported restorations are limited to the following edentulous areas: Mandibular arch (excluding 2nd and 3rd molar areas), Maxillary anterior and premolar areas

Exclusion Criteria:

* Smoker
* Uncontrolled diabetes
* Uncontrolled hypertension
* Bisphosphonate user
* Bruxer
* Extraction site healed less than 6 months
* Women pregnant or lactating at the time of enrollment
* Previous malignant neoplasm
* A known hypersensitivity to Titanium metal
* Any medication/condition that in the opinion of the clinical investigators may adversely affect bone healing
* Any indication of an inability to make autonomous decisions

primary.measure: Number of Implants Functioning in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
primary.description: Dental implant supported restorations functioning in the mouth with no pain, no mobility, no infection and less than 50% bone loss around the implant site.
primary.timeFrame: Baseline to 12 months after implant restoration complete

primary.measure: Number of Implants Functioning in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
primary.description: Dental Implant supported restoration functioning in the mouth with no pain, no mobility, no infection and less than 50% bone loss around the implant site.
primary.timeFrame: Baseline to 24 months after implant restoration complete

primary.measure: Number of Implants Functioning in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
primary.description: Dental implant supported restoration functioning in the mouth with no pain, no mobility, no infection and less than 50% bone loss around the implant site.
primary.timeFrame: Baseline to 36 months after implant restoration complete

secondary.measure: Peri-implant Health and Bone Maintenance as Measured by Radiographic Examination in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
secondary.description: Radiographic examination of implant osseointegration and bone loss by using traditional periapical and/or bitewing radiographs.

secondary.measure: Peri-implant Health and Bone Maintenance as Measured by Radiographic Examination in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
secondary.description: Radiographic examination of implant osseointegration and bone loss by using traditional periapical and/or bitewing radiographs.

secondary.measure: Peri-implant Health and Bone Maintenance as Measured by Radiographic Examination in HIV Positive Subjects Compared to HIV Negative Subjects
secondary.description: Radiographic examination of implant osseointegration and bone loss by using traditional periapical and /or bitewing radiographs.
